greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; a(n)=a(n-1)-1 if n is already in the sequence, a(n)=a(n-1)+4 otherwise.
comment: If, in the defining recurrence, the rule a(n)=a(n-1)+4 when n is not already in the sequence is generalized to a(n)=a(n-1)+k, then the resulting sequence ultimately becomes periodic with period 1,3,10,35 for k=1,2,3,4, respectively. - _John W. Layman_, Apr 15 2003
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Feb 14 2003
ext: More terms from _John W. Layman_, Apr 15 2003
